title: evening poem
text:
At dusk all the bees are in their beds
little white flowers spread over the grass
look like flecks of cocaine
soon to be hoovered up by my lawnmower
I am the stillness of the trees
and the whir of the motorway
I am the little bats
that dance around my resting head
their little wings nodding at the dead

title: two lonely children
text:
You are all talk
I'm all talk too
we dance
and dance
until our heads are spinning
just for a chance
tos say that we're winning
don't look inside
to what we cover up
 two lonely children
in our hearts
are stuck

title: father's day poem
text:
To Dad
I write the cursive in the card
free and easy
happy father's day
I don't elaborate
I know you're understated
and you'll feel it
even the way
I sign my brother's name
like he did it himself
it is all done
with love

Dogs bark
the day goes dark
clouds part
attention sparks
the great unknown
in my little heart
a squeeky fart
is a false start
I've shat myself

title: watching old videos
text:
watching
old videos of
myself
and Tom
and Dom
and laughing so hard
at our old house
and Tom

my Mum said
"you should have both gone
to drama school"
and she's right
but instead
I'll hold
 on to all
 of us laughing
together

title: the night blue sky
text:
the night blue sky
and the gentle leaves
I write to see
I write to see
something changed
inside of me
when I wrote plain words
with a cup of tea
I step outside
to the quiet breeze
and at last I see
the night blue sky
and the gentle leaves

title: dead cat poem
text:
dead cat
black cat
at the end 
of the garden
he came into
the house
through the
backdoor

he stared
at me
with
yellow
eyes

I shooed him outside
until he was scared
looking back
at me
from the grass

he stared
at me
with
yellow eyes

I got scared
so I shot him there
his life
became one
with the night
and that's how
the dead cat that stared
with yellow eyes
came to be buried
in the
garden
ndarkness

title: a long black at the garden centre
text:
a long black at the garden centre
I will buy some flowers for Gran
my bike is in a shop in Silverdale called Spokes
the sun hasn't stopped shining
but the air is cool and fresh
I call now instead of text
Grandad is having a new carpet fitted
I'm booked in to shift some furniture with him next week
I'm seeing my pal James tomorrow
we might watch Villa vs PSG
but it'll depend on how tired I am
because it's on late
the only negative is when it gets dark in the evenings
and I'm alone in the house
but spring is here
I feel it for the first time
two weeks I've been back
I ask
how long does it take to feel settled?
if I can do this with my own support
I can do anything
